title: What are some 80's and 90's songs that have famous synth introductions? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'll jump in here just to list a few that haven't been given yet, but certainly should: Take On Me by A-haBorn In The USA and Dancing In The Dark by Bruce Springsteen and the E Street BandStand Back by Stevie Nicks (and Prince)Tell It To My Heart by Taylor DaneStrangelove, The Policy Of Truth, The Highlander Mix of Stripped, It's No Good, and basically everything by Depeche ModeThe Finer Things and many more by Steve WinwoodShell Shock and also a bunch more by New OrderA totally obscure, but very deserving If I Found Rome by The StabilizersRunaway by Bon JoviIf you're interested in #8, I just found a YouTube video for it. What impressed me wasn't the arp at the beginning, but the booming WHOOOOHHHH pad that follows it. I'd just about kill to learn how they pulled that off. Best part, these guys were local to my home town of Erie, PA. Enjoy!

I’ll stick with the early 80s, and won’t repeat anything that has already been mentioned. Kinda tough to adhere to the “synth introductions” restriction, which leaves many famous keyboard lines out of the running. Oh well. As far as famous, they’re famous to me! *** Harold Faltermeyer - Axel F (1984)  Ministry - Revenge (1983)  Real Life - Send Me An Angel (1983)  Yaz - Don’t Go (1982)  Newcleus - Jam On It (1984)  Depeche Mode - Just Can’t Get Enough (1981)
